skill.name: raindrop-io
skill.description: Manage Raindrop.io bookmarks with AI assistance. Save and organize bookmarks, search your collection, manage reading lists, and organize research materials. Use when working with bookmarks, web research, reading lists, or when user mentions Raindrop.io.
skill.summary: AI-powered Raindrop.io bookmark manager for saving, organizing, and searching bookmarks through natural language
skill.author: DanSega1

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate instruction-only skill for managing Raindrop.io bookmarks via the official MCP server. All 356 static findings are false positives - they detect example commands and URLs in documentation files (README.md, references/*.md), not actual executable code. The skill contains no scripts, no malicious patterns, and no prompt injection attempts. The 'external_commands' detections are documentation showing users what commands they can type. The 'network' detections are legitimate documentation links. The 'blocker' detections are false positives from documentation text mentioning OAuth and API keys. Risk level: SAFE.

dangerous_patterns.title: False Positive: Documentation Command Examples
dangerous_patterns.description: The static scanner detected 'external_commands' in markdown documentation files. These are example commands shown in README.md and references/*.md for instructional purposes, not actual executable code in the skill. This is a documentation skill with no scripts.

dangerous_patterns.title: False Positive: Documentation URL Links
dangerous_patterns.description: The static scanner detected 'network' patterns for hardcoded URLs. These are legitimate documentation links to Raindrop.io website, API documentation, and help pages. No network requests are made by this skill.

dangerous_patterns.title: False Positive: Cryptographic Algorithm Detection
dangerous_patterns.description: The static scanner flagged 'weak cryptographic algorithm' patterns. These are false positives from documentation text mentioning OAuth 2.1, API keys, and authentication methods. The skill does not implement any cryptographic algorithms.

content.value_statement: Save, organize, and search your Raindrop.io bookmarks through natural language conversations with AI. Perfect for researchers, developers, and anyone who wants to manage their web bookmarks efficiently.
actual_capabilities: Save bookmarks to Raindrop.io collections with automatic tagging
Search bookmarks by tags, collection, domain, date range, or full-text search
Manage reading lists with progress tracking and highlights
Organize research projects with collections, tags, and bulk operations
Create, update, and delete collections and tags
Extract and export highlights from saved articles
limitations: Requires Raindrop.io Pro subscription ($28/year) for MCP access
Depends on official Raindrop.io MCP server which is in beta
Cannot access Raindrop.io without proper OAuth authorization
Some MCP features may have limited functionality during beta

use_cases.title: Research Project Management
use_cases.description: Create collections for research projects, systematically tag sources, and export highlights for literature reviews.

use_cases.title: Developer Documentation Library
use_cases.description: Save and organize technical documentation, API references, and code tutorials with systematic tagging.

use_cases.title: Personal Reading List
use_cases.description: Save articles to a reading list, track progress, mark as read, and extract key highlights.
use_cases.target_user: Anyone who wants to manage their reading

prompt_templates.title: Save a Bookmark
prompt_templates.prompt: Save this URL to my [collection name] collection: [URL]. Tag it with [tag1, tag2].
prompt_templates.scenario: Adding a new bookmark with specific collection and tags

prompt_templates.title: Search Bookmarks
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all my bookmarks about [topic] from the last [time period]. Show me results tagged with [tag].
prompt_templates.scenario: Finding bookmarks by topic and time range

prompt_templates.title: Manage Reading List
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me my reading list. Mark the bookmark at [URL] as read and add this highlight: [quote].
prompt_templates.scenario: Updating reading progress and adding highlights

prompt_templates.title: Organize Research
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new collection called [project name] for my [topic] research. Set up tags for [tag1, tag2, tag3].

output_examples.input: Save https://example.com/article to my reading list, tag it with python and tutorial
output_examples.output: Done! I've saved the bookmark to your Reading List collection with the tags: python, tutorial. The bookmark is now available in your reading list.

output_examples.input: Find all my bookmarks about machine learning
output_examples.output:
Found 12 bookmarks about machine learning:

1. Neural Networks Guide (machinelearning.org) - tagged: ml, neural-networks
2. PyTorch Tutorial (pytorch.org) - tagged: ml, python, deep-learning
3. TensorFlow Docs (tensorflow.org) - tagged: ml, tensorflow

Would you like me to show more details or refine the search?

best_practices: Use consistent, lowercase hyphenated tags (e.g., 'machine-learning' not 'Machine Learning')
Create dedicated collections for different projects or topics to keep bookmarks organized
Review and clean up untagged bookmarks weekly to maintain a useful library
anti_patterns: Saving URLs without adding relevant tags or assigning to a collection
Using inconsistent tagging conventions across different bookmarks
Creating too many collections which makes it harder to find bookmarks

faq.question: Do I need a Raindrop.io subscription?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill requires a Raindrop.io Pro subscription ($28/year) because the official MCP server is only available to Pro users.

faq.question: Which AI clients work with this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude Code, Claude Desktop, Claude.ai, ChatGPT (Plus/Pro/Business), Cursor, Windsurf, and any other MCP-compatible client.

faq.question: Is my data secure?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill uses OAuth 2.1 for authentication. Your bookmarks remain in your Raindrop.io account and are not stored outside their servers.

faq.question: Can I use this skill offline?
faq.answer: No, this skill requires an internet connection to communicate with the Raindrop.io MCP server and API.

faq.question: What happens if the MCP server is down?
faq.answer: If the official Raindrop.io MCP server is unavailable, the skill won't be able to perform operations. Check status at help.raindrop.io/mcp for updates.

faq.question: Can I contribute to this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, this is an open-source skill. You can contribute by reporting issues, improving documentation, or sharing workflow patterns on GitHub.
